title: Environmental and Exploration Geophysics
description: Theory and practice of nonseismic geophysics for groundwater, environmental, and exploration purposes. Lectures are supplemented by collection of gravity, magnetic, and resistivity data; data analysis; and report writing. Includes an introduction to MATLAB as a tool for geophysical data interpretation. Prerequisites: MATH 20C or MATH 31BH, and PHYS 2C, or consent of instructor.
